noun.description: A card game for two players in which the object is to acquire one's opponent's cards. Players alternately turn cards up and if an honor is revealed, the other player must find an honor within a specified number of turns or else forfeit the cards already played.

adjective.description: (especially of national policy) self-aggrandizing at the expense of competitors.
examples: failure would create a growing risk of trade wars as countries retreated into beggar-thy-neighbor policies
